Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: ComponentName: This value must never be null.
setActivity(android.content.ComponentNam.Description: Sets the target activity. A shortcut will be shown along with this activity's icon on the launcher. When selecting a target activity, keep the following in mind: All dynamic shortcuts must have a target activity. When a shortcut with no target activity is published using @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager#addDynamicShortcuts_E@ or @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager#setDynamicShortcuts_E@, the first main activity defined in the app's AndroidManifest.xml file is used. Only "main" activities—ones that define the @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_MAIN_E@ and @B_android#content#Intent#CATEGORY_LAUNCHER_E@ intent filters—can be target activities. By default, the first main activity defined in the app's manifest is the target activity. A target activity must belong to the publisher app.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
setRank(int).Description: "Rank" of a shortcut, which is a non-negative value that's used by the launcher app to sort shortcuts. See @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#getRank_E@ for details.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
setCategories(java.util.Set<java.lang.St.Description: Sets categories for a shortcut. Launcher apps may use this information to categorize shortcuts.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: LocusId: This value must never be null.
setLocusId(android.content.LocusId).Description: Sets the @B_android#content#LocusId_E@ associated with this shortcut. This method should be called when the @B_android#content#LocusId_E@ is used in other places (such as @B_android#app#Notification_E@ and @B_android#view#contentcapture#ContentCaptureContext_E@) so the Android system can correlate them.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: CharSequence: This value must never be null.
setLongLabel(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the text of a shortcut. This field is intended to be more descriptive than the shortcut title. The launcher shows this instead of the short title when it has enough space. The recommend maximum length is 25 characters.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: CharSequence: This value must never be null.
setDisabledMessage(java.lang.CharSequenc.Description: Sets the message that should be shown when the user attempts to start a shortcut that is disabled.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: CharSequence: This value must never be null.
setShortLabel(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the short title of a shortcut. This is a mandatory field when publishing a new shortcut with @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager#addDynamicShortcuts_E@ or @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager#setDynamicShortcuts_E@. This field is intended to be a concise description of a shortcut. The recommended maximum length is 10 characters.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: Intent: This value must never be null.
setIntents(android.content.Intent[]).Description: Sets multiple intents instead of a single intent, in order to launch an activity with other activities in back stack. Use @B_android#app#TaskStackBuilder_E@ to build intents. The last element in the list represents the only intent that doesn't place an activity on the back stack. See the @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager_E@ javadoc for details.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: Person: This value must never be null.
setPerson(android.app.Person).Description: Add a person that is relevant to this shortcut. Alternatively, @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder#setPersons_E@ can be used to add multiple persons to a shortcut. This is an optional field, but the addition of person may cause this shortcut to appear more prominently in the user interface (e.g. ShareSheet). A person should usually contain a uri in order to benefit from the ranking boost. However, even if no uri is provided, it's beneficial to provide people in the shortcut, such that listeners and voice only devices can announce and handle them properly.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
setIcon(android.graphics.drawable.Icon).Description: Sets an icon of a shortcut. Icons are not available on @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo_E@ instances returned by @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager_E@ or @B_android#content#pm#LauncherApps_E@. The default launcher app can use @B_android#content#pm#LauncherApps#getShortcutIconDrawable_E@ or @B_android#content#pm#LauncherApps#getShortcutBadgedIconDrawable_E@ to fetch shortcut icons. Tints set with @B_android#graphics#drawable#Icon#setTint_E@ or @B_android#graphics#drawable#Icon#setTintList_E@ are not supported and will be ignored. Only icons created with @B_android#graphics#drawable#Icon#createWithBitmap_E@, @B_android#graphics#drawable#Icon#createWithAdaptiveBitmap_E@ and @B_android#graphics#drawable#Icon#createWithResource_E@ are supported. Other types, such as URI-based icons, are not supported.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: PersistableBundle: This value must never be null.
setExtras(android.os.PersistableBundle).Description: Extras that the app can set for any purpose. Apps can store arbitrary shortcut metadata in extras and retrieve the metadata later using @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#getExtras_E@.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: Person: This value must never be null.
setPersons(android.app.Person[]).Description: Sets multiple persons instead of a single person.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
Parameters: Intent: This value must never be null.
setIntent(android.content.Intent).Description: Sets the intent of a shortcut. Alternatively, @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder#setIntents_E@ can be used to launch an activity with other activities in the back stack. This is a mandatory field when publishing a new shortcut with @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager#addDynamicShortcuts_E@ or @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutManager#setDynamicShortcuts_E@. A shortcut can launch any intent that the publisher app has permission to launch. For example, a shortcut can launch an unexported activity within the publisher app. A shortcut intent doesn't have to point at the target activity. The given intent can contain extras, but these extras must contain values of primitive types in order for the system to persist these values.

Returns: @B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo_E@
This value will never be null.
@B_android#content#pm#ShortcutInfo#Builder_E@
This value will never be null.
setLongLived(boolean).Description: Sets if a shortcut would be valid even if it has been unpublished/invisible by the app (as a dynamic or pinned shortcut). If it is long lived, it can be cached by various system services even after it has been unpublished as a dynamic shortcut.
